title: Did Govt or WHO issue advisory on the purchase of Holi products from China? Here’s the truth | Newsmobile
author: newsmobile.in
vclaim:
Ahead of Holi, a viral message attributed to the World Health Organisation is being circulated on social media with a claim that cheap Holi colours are made in China and they might contain Coronavirus. The message warns people against using such Holi colours.

ALSO READ: Did Shah Jahan kill Mumtaz’s husband to marry her? Here’s the…

We checked the viral post and found it to be FAKE.

Firstly, we noticed that the message claims to be an advisory from WHO and in the next line “The preamble of India” is also present.

We checked online and did not find and credible reports to support the claim.

Moreover, the advisory has multiple grammatical and spelling mistakes.

In the advisory, the city of Hunei is mention as the epicentre of Coronavirus. But, Hunei is a district in Taiwan whereas China’s Hubei province is the centre of the Covid-19 outbreak.

The above information proves that this advisory is FAKE.
